init.title: Hub Configuration
init.description: Configure options for this Emergency Alerts hub.

global_options.title: Global Emergency Alerts Settings
global_options.description: Configure global settings that apply to all Emergency Alerts.

data_description.default_escalation_time: Default time in seconds before alerts escalate if not acknowledged (60-3600 seconds)
data_description.enable_global_notifications: Send notifications for all emergency alerts using the global service
data_description.global_notification_service: Service to use for global notifications (e.g., 'notify.notify' or 'notify.mobile_app_phone')
data_description.global_notification_message: Template for global notification messages. Available variables: {alert_name}, {severity}, {group}, {entity_id}

group_options.title: Manage {group_name} Alerts
group_options.description: Choose an action to manage alerts in this group. Currently {alert_count} alert(s) configured.

add_alert.title: Add Emergency Alert
add_alert.description: Configure a new emergency alert for this group.

data_description.name: A unique name for this emergency alert within the group
data_description.trigger_type: How this alert should be triggered - Simple monitors one entity, Template uses Jinja2 expressions, Logical combines multiple conditions
data_description.entity_id: The Home Assistant entity to monitor (required for Simple triggers)
data_description.trigger_state: The state value that triggers this alert (e.g., 'on', 'open', 'high', or numeric values)
data_description.template: Jinja2 template that returns true/false (e.g., {{ states('sensor.temperature')|float > 30 }})
data_description.logical_conditions: JSON or YAML list of conditions to combine with AND logic
data_description.severity: Severity level affects how the alert is displayed and prioritized
data_description.on_triggered: List of services to call when alert is triggered (JSON: [{"service": "notify.notify", "data": {"message": "Alert!"}}])
data_description.on_cleared: List of services to call when alert condition clears
data_description.on_escalated: List of services to call if alert is not acknowledged within the escalation time

data_description.action: Choose whether to save your changes or delete this alert entirely
data_description.name: A descriptive name for this alert (e.g., 'Front Door Open', 'High Temperature')
data_description.trigger_type:
**Simple**: Monitor one entity's state
**Template**: Use Jinja2 for complex conditions
**Logical**: Combine multiple entity conditions
data_description.entity_id: The Home Assistant entity to watch (e.g., binary_sensor.front_door, sensor.temperature)
data_description.trigger_state:
What state should trigger the alert? Examples:
‚Ä¢ `on` for binary sensors
‚Ä¢ `unavailable` for offline devices
‚Ä¢ `30` for numeric thresholds
data_description.template:
Jinja2 template returning True/False. Example:
`{{ states('sensor.temperature')|float > 25 and states('sensor.humidity')|float < 30 }}`
data_description.severity:
**Critical**: Urgent issues requiring immediate attention
**Warning**: Important but not critical
**Info**: General notifications
data_description.escalation_minutes: If not acknowledged within this time, escalation actions will run (leave empty to disable)
data_description.on_cleared: Services to run when alert automatically clears
data_description.on_escalated: Services to run if alert is not acknowledged within escalation time
